column.name: Gaia_designation
column.description: The Gaia DR3 object ID.

column.name: Gaia_RA
column.description: Right Ascension of the Gaia DR3 source.

column.name: Gaia_Dec
column.description: The Gaia DR3 declination.

column.name: BP
column.description: The BP magnitude, from Gaia DR3.

column.name: G
column.description: The Gaia DR3 G magnitude.

column.name: RP
column.description: The Gaia DR3 RP magnitude.

column.name: CatWISE_Name
column.description: The object identifier from the CatWISE 2020 catalogue.

column.name: CatWISE_RA
column.description: Right Ascension of the object as quoted by the CatWISE 2020 catalogue.

column.name: CatWISE_Dec
column.description: CatWISE 2020 Declination.

column.name: W1
column.description: W1 magnitude from CatWISE 2020.

column.name: W2
column.description: W2 magnitude from CatWISE 2020.

column.name: match_p
column.description: Overall probability that the Gaia DR3 and CatWISE sources are detections of the same object, as given by equation 26 of Wilson & Naylor (2018a).

column.name: Separation
column.description: On-sky distance between the two detections, in arcseconds.

column.name: eta
column.description: Photometric logarithmic likelihood ratio of Gaia DR3-CatWISE match, as described by equation 37 of Wilson & Naylor (2018a).

column.name: xi
column.description: Astrometric logarithmic likelihood ratio of Gaia DR3-CatWISE match, as described by equation 38 of Wilson & Naylor (2018a).

column.name: Gaia_avg_cont
column.description: Mean contaminating relative flux within simulated Gaia PSFs perturbation component of the Astrometric Uncertainty Function at the local density and magnitude of the source.

column.name: CatWISE_avg_cont
column.description: Mean contaminating relative flux within simulated CatWISE PSFs perturbation component of the Astrometric Uncertainty Function at the local density and magnitude of the source.

column.name: Gaia_cont_f1
column.description: Probability of Gaia source having contaminant of at least 1% relative flux given its separation from its corresponding Gaia detection, as given by equation 12 of Wilson & Naylor (2018b).

column.name: Gaia_cont_f10
column.description: Probability of Gaia source having contaminant of at least 10% relative flux given its separation from its corresponding Gaia detection, as given by equation 12 of Wilson & Naylor (2018b).

column.name: CatWISE_cont_f1
column.description: Probability of CatWISE source having contaminant of at least 1% relative flux given its separation from its corresponding Gaia detection, as given by equation 12 of Wilson & Naylor (2018b).

column.name: CatWISE_cont_f10
column.description: Probability of CatWISE source having contaminant of at least 10% relative flux given its separation from its corresponding Gaia detection, as given by equation 12 of Wilson & Naylor (2018b).

column.name: CatWISE_fit_sig
column.description: Re-derived CatWISE astrometric uncertainty, based on ensemble neighbour separations as a function of magnitude and quoted astrometric precision.
